qas.question: Which ancient text provides an example of the humanist way of thinking?
What well know scholar was inspired by Humanism?
Which classified text provides an example of the humanist way of thinking?
What well know scholar was destroyed by Humanism?
When was Gathas of Zarathustra lost forever?
What well know scholar was killed by Humanism?

context: Another instance of ancient humanism as an organised system of thought is found in the <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Gathas of Zarathustra<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>, composed <b5_0>between 1,000 BCE – 600 BCE<b5_0/> in Greater Iran. Zarathustra's philosophy in the Gathas lays out a conception of humankind as thinking beings dignified with choice and agency according to the intellect which each receives from Ahura Mazda (God in the form of supreme wisdom). The idea of Ahura Mazda as a non-intervening deistic divine God/Grand Architect of the universe tied with a unique eschatology and ethical system implying that each person is held morally responsible for their choices, made freely in this present life, in the <a1_0>afterlife<a1_0/>. The importance placed on thought, action, responsibility, and a non-intervening creator was appealed to by, and inspired a number of, Enlightenment humanist thinkers in Europe such as <a2_0><b6_0>Voltaire<b6_0/><a2_0/> and Montesquieu.
